sentences.english: They are not shamed to display their beauty drunkenly.
sentences.chinese: 它们倒也一点不害羞，忘我的展示它们的美丽。

sentences.english: In God's garden of love, you are His forget-me-not.
sentences.chinese: 在上帝爱的花园里，你是他的“勿忘我”。

sentences.english: Teaching calls for enthusiasm and selflessness.
sentences.chinese: 教学需要热情和忘我的精神。

sentences.english: Both teachers and students work extremely hard.
sentences.chinese: 老师工作忘我，学生学习努力。

sentences.english: Is a growth in the water blue flower "forget-me-not".
sentences.chinese: 是一个成长中的水蓝色的花“勿忘我没有”。

sentences.english: It was numbing work, requiring patience and dedication.
sentences.chinese: 这是一种令人麻木的工作，需要有耐心和忘我精神。

sentences.english: A higher magnification of forget-me-not pollen on a petal .
sentences.chinese: 高倍放大的勿忘我花瓣上的花粉。

sentences.english: Forget me not, never let me wait till whitened all.
sentences.chinese: 勿忘我，别叫我，盼到白首。
我们追随着那条开满勿忘我的小径。

sentences.english: Work as if you have no need of the money.
sentences.chinese: 忘我的工作，就像你不需要钱一样。

sentences.english: An individual performing altruistic acts gain nothing for himself.
sentences.chinese: 行使忘我主义行为的个体没有为自身赢得什么。

sentences.english: I think the greatest masters go on to achieve a kind of selflessness.
sentences.chinese: 我认为最伟大的大师们有一种忘我的精神。

sentences.english: He doveted himself into the work in a selfless manner.
sentences.chinese: 他已一种忘我姿态投入到紧张的工作当中去。

sentences.english: Theyare 15 times larger than those on a Forget-me-not
sentences.chinese: 它们比勿忘我的花粉大15倍。

sentences.english: He has dedicated himself to his work and become just a writing machine .
sentences.chinese: 他忘我地投入工作，就像是一台写作机器。

sentences.english: Only those who work selflessly are able to gain time.
sentences.chinese: 只有忘我工作的人才能赢得时间。

definition: wholeheartedly/(to devote oneself) heart and soul
to get carried away/to forget oneself
to be infatuated with/to be drunk with/to be enchanted with/to revel in
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
to indulge in/to wallow/absorbed in/deeply engrossed/addicted
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth/also written 如癡如醉|如痴如醉[ru2 chi1 ru2 zui4]
to find amusement in one's own way/to enjoy oneself quietly
